entry.title: Turkey ‚Äòhopes for‚Äô Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization soon, says Erdoƒüan

media:group.media:title: Turkey ‚Äòhopes for‚Äô Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization soon, says Erdoƒüan
media:group.media:description:
üìç Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoƒüan expressed hope that Armenia and Azerbaijan will sign a normalization agreement by the end of the year. üìç Dozens of Nagorno-Karabakh Armenians protested in Yerevan asking for the government‚Äôs help repatriating the bodies of soldiers killed in Azerbaijan‚Äôs attack last September. üìç Armenia‚Äôs Investigative Committee alleges that former Artsakh official Sargis Galstyan began spying for Azerbaijan after the end of the 2020 war. üìç Former Nagorno-Karabakh resident Rashid Beglaryan, who was taken prisoner by Azerbaijan last August, was sentenced by a Baku court to 15 years in prison.

entry.title: Armenia's renewed drive towards public administration reform

media:group.media:title: Armenia's renewed drive towards public administration reform
media:group.media:description:
In this in-depth discussion, Viktorya Aydinyan, advisor to the Deputy Prime Minister of Armenia, delves into the country‚Äôs public administration reform agenda. She examines the goals and early progress of efforts aiming to modernize governance, enhance service delivery, and improve policy planning. Aydinyan addresses the challenges of driving transformation across the government, and empowering citizens with a more participatory, digitally-oriented civil service.

entry.title: Russia expresses ‚Äòdeep regret‚Äô over Armenia‚Äôs NATO summit participation

media:group.media:title: Russia expresses ‚Äòdeep regret‚Äô over Armenia‚Äôs NATO summit participation
media:group.media:description:
üìç There were no indications of any further progress toward a normalization deal after the top diplomats of Armenia and Azerbaijan held their latest round of talks in Washington. üìç Armenia opened a criminal probe on suspicion of traffic violations after two people were killed and another five injured when a car transporting demobilized servicemen crashed. üìç Members of a group advocating for the right of Armenians forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh to return to their homes met with United Nations representatives. üìç Insights with Eric Hacopian: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Dg4jzFFpXY

media:group.media:title: Can Lake Sevan be saved?
media:group.media:description:
This week on Insights, Eric Hacopian is coming to you from the shores of Lake Sevan. First, he examines recent comments made by the US Secretary of State regarding the so-called peace process between Armenia and Azerbaijan. Then, Eric delves into environmental issues in Armenia, with a specific emphasis on water policy in a country facing geographic challenges.

entry.title: Armenian, Azerbaijan confirm meeting of Foreign Ministers in Washington

media:group.media:title: Armenian, Azerbaijan confirm meeting of Foreign Ministers in Washington
media:group.media:description:
üìç USAID chief Samantha Power arrived in Yerevan for meetings with senior officials, as well as with Armenians forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh last year. üìç The top diplomats of Armenia and Azerbaijan will meet today on the sidelines of a NATO summit in Washington. üìç The United States will seize a Los Angeles mansion belonging to the family of former Armenian official Gagik Khachatryan and may transfer some of the proceeds of the property‚Äôs future sale to the Armenian government, the Justice Department said. üìç Interview with L√©a Hakim, senior country economist for Armenia at the World Bank: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rUD0hckgUFY
